state_food_safety.note: Each state has a State Food Safety Commissioner under the FSS Act, 2006. Contact through state Food & Drug Administration (FDA) office. FSSAI regional offices handle inter-state issues.

online_portals.name: RTI Online Portal (Central Government)
online_portals.note: Covers all central government ministries and departments. Fee: Rs 10 online.

online_portals.name: State RTI Portals
online_portals.note: Many states have their own online RTI portals. Search '[State name] RTI online portal'. Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Delhi have functional online portals.

filing: Use RTI Online (rtionline.gov.in) for central agencies — fastest and cheapest
For state agencies, check if state has an online portal before sending by post
Postal RTI: Use Registered Post or Speed Post with tracking for proof of delivery
Keep photocopies of everything — application, postal receipt, money order receipt
If you don't know which department holds the information, file with the most likely one — they are legally required to transfer under Section 6(3) within 5 days
drafting: Be specific — 'inspection reports for [facility name] from [date] to [date]'
Ask for copies of documents, not summaries
One topic per RTI — mixing topics gives agencies an excuse to partially respond
Ask for 'information held in electronic form' to avoid copying charges
follow_up: Mark the 30-day deadline on your calendar immediately after filing
If no response by day 30, file First Appeal on day 31
First Appeal to the Appellate Authority within 30 days of response/non-response
Second Appeal to CIC/SIC within 90 days of first appeal decision
CIC can impose penalty of Rs 250/day on PIO, max Rs 25,000
